thread.title: PREP FOOTBALL: Fairview-Guntersville scheduled for Saturday at 7 p.m.
thread.title_full: PREP FOOTBALL: Fairview-Guntersville scheduled for Saturday at 7 p.m.

author: robk@cullmantimes.com(Rob Ketcham)
title: PREP FOOTBALL: Fairview-Guntersville scheduled for Saturday at 7 p.m.
text:
by Rob Ketcham 
Saturday football is coming to Oliver Woodard Stadium for a second time this fall. 
Circumstances have this week’s Class 5A, Region 7 game pitting Fairview against third-ranked Guntersville slated for Saturday at 7 p.m. at Cullman High. 
For Aggie fans doubling as Alabama faithful, you’ll have a choice to make. The Tide are set to kick off versus Arkansas at 6 p.m. 
With Dafford Smith Stadium still condemned, the Purple and Gold are in the second year of playing their home games in Bearcat country. This week is homecoming at Cullman, however, taking Thursday and Friday out of the equation and leaving Saturday as the only legitimate option. 
Fairview is 2-4 overall and winless in region play. Undefeated Guntersville (6-0, 4-0) is coming off its closest contest, a 21-20 thriller over Etowah. 
Oliver Woodard Stadium also hosted West Point, Fairview and Curry for a preseason jamboree, though the evening was shortened by showers.
